channel.title: Jython
channel.description: Well, how does Jython actually work? Do you create a python file and then implement it from the Java class? I was thinking it was like that, but I want to make sure before I actually work with Jython.

item.title: Jython
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Itâ€™s a Java impl of Python. To run the python scripts, you intialize a PythonInterpreter, and use exec() to execute code or eval() to evaluate an expression.

ORRR you can use the javax.script implementation for it and use that interface. (Look up JSR 223)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 02, 2009, 04:31:19 pm[/size][hr]You can also execute a python script file via PythonInterpreter.execfile()

Read full topic
